title: How to Make Chorizo and Garbanzo Tapas

steps.headline: Put 6 tablespoons of the olive oil into a bowl with 2 tablespoons of sherry vinegar and mix them together.
steps.description: If desired, add a bit more sherry vinegar to taste.

steps.headline: Season with salt and pepper to taste and then set the bowl aside.
Remove the casing from the sausage with a knife.
Cut the sausage into 1/4 of an inch slices then cut the circular slices into half-moon shapes.
Heat the rest of the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat.
steps.description: Add the onion and cook them for 2-3 minutes, stirring to cook them evenly.

steps.headline: Drop the sausage into the skillet and continue to cook for 3 more minutes, or until the sausage is completely cooked.
Remove the sausage and onion with a slotted spoon and drain them, of all excess oil, on paper towels.
Once they are dry, put all of the sausage and onion into the bowl of olive oil and sherry vinegar dressing and stir it all together.
Empty the can of garbanzo beans into a strainer and rinse them with cold water.
steps.description: Shake off all the excess water.

steps.headline: Put the garbanzo beans into the bowl with the other ingredients.
steps.description: Set the bowl aside for the ingredients to cool.

steps.headline: Before serving taste and adjust the seasoning.

text: Put 6 tablespoons of the olive oil into a bowl with 2 tablespoons of sherry vinegar and mix them together. If desired, add a bit more sherry vinegar to taste. Season with salt and pepper to taste and then set the bowl aside.  Remove the casing from the sausage with a knife.  Cut the sausage into 1/4 of an inch slices then cut the circular slices into half-moon shapes.  Heat the rest of the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook them for 2-3 minutes, stirring to cook them evenly. Drop the sausage into the skillet and continue to cook for 3 more minutes, or until the sausage is completely cooked.  Remove the sausage and onion with a slotted spoon and drain them, of all excess oil, on paper towels.  Once they are dry, put all of the sausage and onion into the bowl of olive oil and sherry vinegar dressing and stir it all together.  Empty the can of garbanzo beans into a strainer and rinse them with cold water. Shake off all the excess water. Put the garbanzo beans into the bowl with the other ingredients. Set the bowl aside for the ingredients to cool. Before serving taste and adjust the seasoning. Sprinkle with oregano. Serve with fresh yummy bread.
